name: Hammer Curls
how_to_perform:
1. Hold a pair of dumbbells with your palms facing towards you (towards your body).

2. Bend your knees slightly and lean forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.

3. Keeping your upper arms still, bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells downwards and in towards your shoulders, keeping your palms facing towards your body.

4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement with your fists resting on either side of your thighs.

5. Then, extend your wrists and raise the dumbbells back up to the starting position.

6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Hammer curls are an arms exercise that target your brachialis muscles, which run from the inside part of your elbow to the outside part, while also engaging adjacent areas like the biceps and forearms.
